repository.corpname: M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections & Archives

did.unittitle: Office of the Assistant to the President Records1949-1974

origination.label: creator
origination.persname: State Univeristy of New York at Albany

did.abstract: This collection contains materials related to administration of the University at Albany and was created by the Assistant to the President.
did.physloc: Materials are located onsite in the department.

bioghist.head: Administrative History
bioghist.p: The Office of the Assistant to the President has been a dynamic role in the University Administration. They have worked performing day to day clerical work, corresponding with other institutions and sometimes acting in the president's stead.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection is made up of materials collected by the Office of the Assistant to the President. They include budgets requests for the university, correspondence with university employees as well as other institutions, and other general administrative materials.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Materials were given to the University at Albany from the Office of the Assistant to the President at an unknown date.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: Collection is organized in five different series covering various assistants as well as general administrative documents.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this group is unrestricted.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: This page may contain links to digital objects. Access to these images and the technical capacity to download them does not imply permission for re-use. Digital objects may be used freely for personal reference use, referred to, or linked to from other web sites.
Researchers do not have permission to publish or disseminate material from these collections without permission from an archivist and/or the copyright holder.

The researcher assumes full responsibility for conforming to the laws of copyright. Some materials in these collections may be protected by the U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) and/or by the copyright or neighboring-rights laws of other nations. More information about U.S. Copyright is provided by the Copyright Office. Additionally, re-use may be restricted by terms of University Libraries gift or purchase agreements, donor restrictions, privacy and publicity rights, licensing and trademarks.
The University Archives are eager to hear from any copyright owners who are not properly identified so that appropriate information may be provided in the future.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows: Identification of specific item, series, box, folder, Office of the Assistant to the President Records, 1961-1970. M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives, University Libraries, University at Albany, State University of New York (hereafter referred to as the Records of the Office of the Assistant to the President).

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series is arranged in original order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series is made up of various collected budget requests submitted to the main SUNY Administrative offices. They contain plans for the completion of various apsects of the campus during its inital constuction in the late 1960s and early 1970s.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series is arranged in original order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series is made up of correspondence and requests from Clara Maidenbaum's work as Assistant to the Vice President.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series is arranged in its original order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Thsi series is made up of materials transferred by Theodore Jennings. It contains files from the Office of the Assistant to the President including correspondence with other institutions, adminstrative documents, as well as documents from various events the President attended.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series is arranged in its original order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series is made up of documents collected and created by James M. Lewis, Assistant to the President of the Univerisity. Items in the series include correspondecne, profiles on faculty, plans for university initiatives, and invitations for the President to other University functions.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series ia arranged in its original order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series is made up of basic administrative records from the Assistant to the President. Items include correspondence, meeting minutes, documents on University protocol, Radio and television programs from local stations, and information on faculty.
